channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

item.title: Furious over bad polls and criticism of his Covid-19 response, Trump erupts at campaign manager
Fed chair says this is the worst economy in US history
Trump: I didn't say it. (He did. Here's the tape.)
item.description: President Donald Trump falsely claims that he didn't say the US will get to 5 million daily coronavirus tests soon. CNN's Brooke Baldwin and Dr. Sanjay Gupta replay that tape.

item.title: Watch these Irrfan Khan masterpieces to understand his brilliance
Fauci touts 'clear cut' ability of drug to aid Covid-19 recovery
item.description: Patients with advanced Covid-19 who received the experimental drug remdesivir recovered faster than similar patients who received placebo, according to preliminary trial data, the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases said Wednesday.

item.title: Potential coronavirus vaccine being tested could 'supply millions' by end of year
item.description: A German company working with US pharmaceutical giant Pfizer has begun human trials of a potential Covid-19 vaccine that could supply millions by the end of the year, according to the two firms.

item.title: Father opens up on why ER doctor who had coronavirus died by suicide
item.description: The father of Dr. Lorna Breen, a New York City emergency room doctor who recovered from Covid-19, continued to treat coronavirus patients, then died by suicide, remembers his daughter as someone who put her life on the line to help others. The National Suicide Prevention Hotline is 1-800-273-8255 (TALK).

item.title: Tom Hagen, one of Norway's richest men, arrested on suspicion of murdering his wife
item.description: Norwegian multimillionaire Tom Hagen has been arrested on suspicion of killing his wife, Anne-Elisabeth Hagen, who disappeared 18 months ago.

item.title: 'There's a whole fleet of them!' F-18 pilots on spotting UFOs
item.description: The Department of Defense has confirmed that three UFO videos made public over the past several years do indeed show "unidentified aerial phenomena."

item.title: 'What do you want me to do?' Bolsonaro asks as Brazil's death toll tops 5,000
How does India, with 1.3 billion people, have only 1,000 virus deaths?
item.description: Less than a month ago, India's future looked dire.

item.title: Scientists reveal 'crazy beast' with strange mix of traits
item.description: Researchers have uncovered the fossil of an early mammal named the "crazy beast" that lived 66 million years ago on Madagascar, and it's unlike any mammal ever known, living or extinct.

item.title: Soccer player still Covid-19 positive after six weeks
item.description: Juventus striker Paulo Dybala has tested positive for the coronavirus for the fourth time in six weeks, a source close to the player has told CNN.

item.title: A 72-year-old man has completed a solo trans-Atlantic rowing trip in 96 days
item.description: A 72-year-old rower has finished a solo trans-Atlantic crossing he started at the end of January -- well before the coronavirus outbreak had spread around the globe.

item.title: 9 of 22 victims of Nova Scotia rampage died in fires set by gunman, investigators say
item.description: Newly released details about a murder rampage that spanned 16 crime scenes are as puzzling as they are disturbing.

item.title: See shocking footage of violent protests in Lebanon
item.description: Cash-strapped Lebanon is facing growing turmoil after the fallout from the coronavirus outbreak sparked violent protests over rising hunger and poverty. CNN's Jomana Karadsheh reports.

item.title: China's model of control getting support during pandemic
UK House of Lords cuts livestream after accidentally broadcasting personal phone numbers
item.description: The UK's House of Lords suspended its online broadcast on Wednesday after the personal phone numbers of several peers were reportedly aired live a day earlier.

item.title: The world may never recover its thirst for oil
Meat plant workers to Trump: We aren't going to show up
item.description: Meat processing plant workers are concerned about President Donald Trump's executive order that compels plants to remain open during the coronavirus pandemic. Some say they expect staff will refuse to come to work.

item.title: Pence tours clinic without a mask despite policy
item.description: Vice President Pence, who leads the White House's coronavirus task force, did not wear a mask while touring the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota despite being informed that wearing a mask is part of the clinic's policy.

item.title: Navy launches broader investigation into virus-stricken aircraft carrier
item.description: The Navy will announce Wednesday that it is launching a broader inquiry into the circumstances surrounding the outbreak of the coronavirus aboard the USS Theodore Roosevelt aircraft carrier, effectively delaying the Navy recommendation that Captain Brett Crozier should be reinstated, according to two US defense officials and an official briefed on the matter.

item.title: South Africa's HIV failures cost more than 300,000 lives. Now this painful past is helping in Covid-19 fight.
item.description: When President Donald Trump mused recently about injecting household disinfectants as treatment for Covid-19 in the White House briefing room, South Africans were reminded of their own dark past.

item.title: Mark Wahlberg brings Melissa McCarthy's odd dream to life
item.description: Mark Wahlberg crashed Melissa McCarthy's interview on "The Ellen DeGeneres Show" wearing an apron in response to a dream McCarthy says she's had.

item.title: Which languages are easiest -- and most difficult -- for native English speakers to master?
item.description: With so much time on our hands during lockdown, many of us have entertained the idea of expanding our horizons.

item.title: Joe Biden just missed a golden opportunity to address the Tara Reade allegations
FAA looking into a runway incident involving Harrison Ford
item.description: Harrison Ford is speaking out about a runway incident at a California airport last week.

item.title: 1,000-year-old English mill resumes flour production to meet demand
item.description: A 1,000-year-old water mill in southwest England, which previously witnessed global pandemics such as the plague in the 17th century and the 1918 influenza pandemic, has resumed production to meet demand for flour during the current coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Father remembers daughter as an ER doctor who put her life on the line to take care of Covid-19 patients
item.description: Dr. Lorna Breen was not struggling with any emotional difficulties or problems with stress prior to being on the front lines of battling a pandemic, her father says.

item.title: Life inside an Israeli 'Coronavirus Hotel'
item.description: Comedian Noam Shuster documented her experience recovering from Covid-19 while living in a hotel full of strangers in Israel. See how they became her live audience.

item.title: This dinosaur was bigger than T. rex and could swim
item.description: Unlike most dinosaurs, it seems that spinosaurs liked the water.

item.title: Katie Couric recalls 'uncomfortable' Denzel Washington interview
item.description: Katie Couric is recalling an uncomfortable interview she conducted with Denzel Washington.

item.title: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson welcomes baby with partner Carrie Symonds
item.description: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson and partner Carrie Symonds have welcomed the birth of a baby boy at a London hospital, a spokesperson for the couple announced Wednesday, adding that mother and baby are doing very well.

item.title: They were married for 73 years and died 6 hours apart -- both from coronavirus
item.description: Mary Kepler and her husband, Wilford, died hours apart after a lifetime together.

item.title: Want to join my bubble? This is what your future social life could look like
item.description: Never before have so many people in the world lived in such tiny bubbles. With billions across the globe now under coronavirus-related restrictions, it has been weeks or even months for some since we socialized with anyone outside our homes.

item.title: Stephen Colbert and Jake Gyllenhaal join 'sourdough cult'
item.description: Stephen Colbert and Jake Gyllenhaal shared their newfound affinity for bread making during stay-at-home restrictions.

item.title: Marine wildlife is flourishing without us, but will it last?
item.description: It is a now-familiar story: as humans are trapped indoors by the deadly coronavirus, wildlife is taking the opportunity to fill abandoned spaces.

item.title: Cleopatra: The ancient alchemist who quested for gold
item.description: The name Cleopatra probably conjures visions of heavy eye-makeup, snake arm-bracelets and perfume-drenched sails. But the Last Queen of Egypt wasn't the only Cleopatra who wielded extraordinary power in ancient times. All but forgotten today, Cleopatra the Alchemist has never merited a Hollywood epic, but she is thought to be one of the few ancient people to hold the secret of the philosopher's stone -- a mythical process for transforming base metals into gold, and an idea linked with eternal life.

item.title: Nurse sings to ailing hospice care patient
item.description: A nurse's tender moment helped lift the spirits of one Michigan family's ailing father.

item.title: Ferrari star proves as talented at racing esports as he is at the real thing
item.description: Scuderia Ferrari driver Charles Leclerc has said he misses racing and interacting with people the most as he adjusts to life in lockdown.

item.title: Stephen Colbert and Jake Gyllenhaal bonded over sourdough starter
item.description: Who isn't baking right now?

item.title: The exquisite pain that changed my life
item.description: No one element of my life has required such consistent spontaneity (and solvency) as the College Football Bowl schedule.

item.title: The lone surrealist whose erotic art provokes to this day
item.description: Bordeaux, France, 1968. Pierre Molinier puts on some makeup, a black eye mask covers half of his face, fishnet stockings curve around his elegant legs and a metal chain binds them to the stool he sits on. He starts photographing himself, once standing naked in front of the camera, a second time wearing a wig and his bottom facing the lens. This was a typical moment for the French photographer.

item.title: The Liverpool star whose goalscoring conversion rate is even better than Messi at his best
item.description: Every superhero has an origin story. Often there is personal tragedy, suffered at an early age; there can be a long journey from a faraway place and ultimately the discovery and harnessing of their power to transform the world around them.

item.title: Fuming at criticism of his Covid-19 response, Trump ripped Brad Parscale over bad polls and threatened to sue
item.description: Analysis: Trump's not-so-secret plan for his life after leaving the White House

item.title: Trump downplays need for testing in latest whiplash contradiction
item.description: Analysis: Trump still doesn't grasp how bad the crisis is Opinion: Pence unmasked reveals obedience

item.title: Fed chair says this is the worst economy in US history
China to hold annual parliament meeting after two-month delay
item.description: China announced Wednesday it will hold the country's biggest annual political meeting in May following a two-month delay, the strongest signal yet from the Chinese government that it considers the novel coronavirus outbreak to be under control.

item.title: Watch these Irrfan Khan masterpieces to understand his brilliance
item.description: 'Slumdog Millionaire' star Irrfan Khan dies at 53

item.title: New Zealanders crowd fast-food restaurants after lockdown eases
item.description: Police in New Zealand have been required to enforce crowd control measures at a popular fast food outlet after large numbers of people rushed to buy burgers following a relaxing of the country's lockdown measures on Tuesday.
